comment.author: 54829078@N00
comment._content: I do not believe this is an image of a lead mine.  The white "spot" at the top of the mountain is "The Snowshoe" of Snowshoe Mountain.  In order to see it from this angle, this photo would have to have been taken from Willow Creek in the town of Creede itself.  The creek runs through the middle of town and the buildings don't appear to be related to mining.  I think those are simply commercial, residential, and storage buildings similar to those that abut Willow Creek in the town of Creede in the present day.

comment._content: Yes, this is taken at the end of Cliff Street. The big building on the right would later become part of the Creede Repertory Theatre. You can see the front of that building on their website history page about 20 years later... www.creederep.org/about/history.html

comment._content: Feininger would have been standing behind this building, between it and the mountain you can see in the theatre photo.  Willow Creek runs behind this building in their photo, roughly parallel with the main street.
